sn32.56:1.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn32.56:1.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes it becomes windy?”
sn32.56:1.4: “Mendicant, there are what are called gods of the windy clouds.
sn32.56:1.6: ‘Why don’t we revel in our own kind of enjoyment?’ Then, in accordance with their wish, it becomes windy.
sn32.56:1.7: This is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes it becomes windy.”
